text:
I have a mixture of windows & mac os 10.6.4 clients experiencing problems when accessing a server running FreeBSD 8.1/AMD64 with Apache 2.2.16_1 (built via ports).
The specific applications running on these clients which are having problems are sage line 50 on windows xp & adobe indesign cs5 running on mac os x
These apps crash randomly when trying to write data back, with no consistent means of reproducing the issue

On the apache server, the only error I've found being logged at all is : "Could not get next bucket brigade"

Below is the output from the error access & forensics log from a window client accessing the apache server where the "Could not get next bucket brigade" has been logged (output has been obfuscated) (the client did not experience a crash on this occasion)


[Thu Oct 14 12:08:43 2010] [error] [client 192.168.0.10] Could not get next bucket brigade  [500, #0]

192.168.0.10 - myuser [14/Oct/2010:12:08:43 +0000] "PROPFIND /some/ HTTP/1.1" 207 39666 "-" "-" "TLbyy8CoEgEAAON5tyUAAAAJ"

text:
This error message typically indicates that the client did not deliver the announced amount of data at all or within a reasonable timeframe (Hint: Timeout setting in httpd) during a PUT request.
In your access logs this PUT request can seen here:

192.168.0.10 - myuser [14/Oct/2010:12:08:43 +0000] "PUT
/some/path/100823%20New%20Email%20Newsletter/02%20-%20Design/02%20-%20CV%20Update%20eShot/Thumbs.db
HTTP/1.1" 500 535 "-" "-" "TLbyy8CoEgEAAOdDOXwAAAAD"

(See the 500 response code).

So unless there are more facts this is a client bug and not an httpd bug.
creator: rpluem@apache.org
